events.name: September Monthly Meet - Evolving Beyond GREP & Exploration of Steganography
events.description:
Agenda • Food, Drinks & Networking (20 mins) • Introduction & Announcement (10 mins) • Evolving Beyond GREP: Enterprise-Wide Hunting with Execution Artefacts by Bart Inglot (45 mins) • Break (5 mins) • Beginner's Exploration in Steganography by Jonathan Tan (20 mins) 


Abstracts Evolving beyond GREP: Enterprise-wide hunting with execution artefacts by Bart Inglot The talk will present an open-source tool designed to efficiently process, analyse and hunt at enterprise scale using temporal execution artefacts such as ShimCache and AmCache, that for the last 2 years was only available to Mandiant consultants. The talk is full of demos and will present custom-built analytics, such as: time execution correlation, Levenshtein distance analysis and time stacking, to name a few. The talk was designed by the tool author and my dear colleague – Matias Bevilacqua. Beginner's Exploration in Steganography by Jonathan Tan What is steganography and what is it used for? What is least significant bit (LSB) algorithm for steganography? Implementation of LSB in bitmap and the PoC of avoiding detection.  


Speakers' Bio Bart Inglot is an incident response and forensics specialist in Mandiant's security consulting services team helping clients restore confidence in an event of a breach. He holds a degree in computer forensics, is a keen developer, enjoys inspecting network traffic and specialises in Windows forensics. Jonathan Tan is currently a year 2 student in SMU Information Systems. He graduated from Temasek Polytechnic with a Diploma in Cyber & Digital Security. He enjoys the process of hacking and is actively involved in SMU Whitehats Society as the current Honorary General Secretary.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 21 Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: Serverless on Google Cloud, Chatbots & Firebase
events.description:
Hi friends! We're thrilled to have our next Serverless Singapore meetup in September. And this time it will be hosted by Google!  Programme  6:30pm: Doors open - mingle over pizzas 7:00pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7:10pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks  • 'Serverless Compute options on Google Cloud' by Jay Jenkins, Customer Engineer on Google Cloud • 'Chatbots & Firebase' by Manikantan Krishnamurthy (Google) => demo of using GCF, to power a chatbot using api.ai (~10mins) • 'Using Serverless, Google Cloud Functions with Firebase' by Aaron Jiang 


Information for Attendees Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security! The meetup will be held at Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Singapore 117371. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is Labrador Park on Circle Line.  Sponsor
events.location: Google Offices, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Singapore

events.name: The Enemy Within: Insider Threats, True Stories
events.description:
Most major data breaches involve a threat that was already inside. What is usually leaked or stolen? Unstructured data. Documents, spreadsheets, images, videos–what you have the most of and know the least about. The responsibility of your organization gets more and more challenging in protecting data from within.
ISC2, Varonis and PwC are partnering to bring you true stories of insider threats from around the globe and at home. Learn from experiences encountered by other organizations, and better establish a data governance and security platform against insider threats and cyberattacks.
We invite you, the ISC2 Singapore chapter member, to an insightful seminar at National University of Singapore Society (NUSS) with Varonis and PwC. Varonis and PwC look forward to talk about:
a)     Why ransomware is merely a canary in the coal mine – a strong indication of worse things to comeb)    How to mitigate major attacks when the insider is compromised, and the threat now begins from inside the organizationc)     How to always know where sensitive data is and make sure only the right people have access to itd)    A concrete action plan for data governance and securitye)     Getting ready for GDPR, and comply with PDPA.f)     Industry findings and organization experiences
Registration starts at 6:30 pm, and refreshment will be provided. The program highlights are in attached:
Program:6.30 pm to 7 pm  Registration7 pm to 7.30 pm  Varonis to talk about items a to e7.30 pm to 8 pm  PwC to talk about item f8 pm to 8.30 pm  Panel of discussion and Q&A

Presenters:
Arthur YeungSenior Consulting Engineer (APAC) Varonis
 Arthur Yeung leads a regional consulting team in APAC/Japan at Varonis. He holds over 17 years of experience in information technology focused on information security, compliance and IT governance. During his 7 years with Varonis, he has been overseeing data governance and data protection project for over 40 government agencies and hundreds of enterprises across Asia, guiding them to formulate an operational plan to secure their most important data against insider threat and cyber-attacks. He holds the title of Certified Information Systems Auditor and actively speaks in major events across Asia on data governance and security.

Urooj BurneyDirector, Cybersecurity & Privacy Impact (Singapore)PwC
Urooj Burney is Director in PwC’s global cybersecurity practice. Currently based in Singapore, he leads PwC’s Cybersecurity & Privacy Impact Center with regional responsibilities spanning South East Asia, Japan and ANZ. With 18 years of experience across complex, large scale projects, including a role as CISO, his expertise spans activities from strategy to operations.
 
 
This seminar is jointly brought to you by: 
About ISC2(ISC)² Singapore Chapter is based out of Singapore and consists of (ISC)² credential holders throughout Singapore.  Our chapter program provides members with a forum to facilitate the exchange of knowledge and ideas, development of leadership and professional skills, and advancement of information systems security.  We also provide our members with access to a variety of industry resource and educational programs to keep our members informed of the latest advances in technology and techniques. http://www.isc2chapter.sg
 
About Varonis SystemsVaronis is the leading provider of software solutions for unstructured, human-generated enterprise data. Varonis provides an innovative software platform that allows enterprises to map, analyze, manage and migrate their unstructured data. Varonis specializes in human-generated data, a type of unstructured data that includes an enterprise’s spreadsheets, word processing documents, presentations, audio files, video files, emails, text messages and any other data created by employees. This data often contains an enterprise’s financial information, product plans, strategic initiatives, intellectual property and numerous other forms of vital information. IT and business personnel deploy Varonis software for a variety of use cases, including data governance, data security, archiving, file synchronization, enhanced mobile data accessibility and information collaboration.
http://www.varonis.com
 
About PwC SingaporePwC’s purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. PwC is a network of firms in 157 countries with more than 223,000 people who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, advisory and tax services. PwC refers to the PwC network and/or one or more of its member firms, each of which is a separate legal entity.
http://www.pwc.com/sg


Disclaimer:
(ISC)2 Singapore Chapter is not responsible for any form of damages, losses incurred which may or may not be related to this event before, during and after the event. This event may be rescheduled or cancelled without notice.
Singapore's Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)  By signing up for an (ISC)2 Singapore Chapter event, you agree and consent for the (ISC)2 Singapore Chapter to collect, retain use and otherwise disclose your personal data and all matters connected with the event for the purpose of providing information, services, rewards, promotions and other relevant purposes connected with the (ISC)2 Singapore Chapter. (ISC)2 Singapore Chapter is committed to take appropriate steps where reasonable to safeguard the privacy of your information as pursuant to the Terms and Conditions of the PDPA.
events.location: School of Economics & Social Sciences, Singapore Management University, 90 Stamford Road, Level 3, seminar room 3.2, Singapore 178903

events.name: WWCode Kotlin Coding Session
events.description: Kotlin has been steadily on the rise and is now being widely adopted. Touted as an open source language developed by the industry programmers to address problems Java developers face in the industry.  Renu Yadav, intrepid mobile developer, will be leading us in this hands on coding session to learn and tackle Kotlin on IntelliJ. Please bring your own laptop and make sure you have downloaded and installed JVM IntelliJ IDEA. [https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/]  Agenda:6:30pm Registration and Food7:00pm Introductions7:10pm Kotlin Coding7:50pm Break8:00pm Kotlin Coding8:30pm Wrap up This workshop assumes familiarity with Java. This workshop is intended for ladies, and is open to everyone who is there to inspire women to excel in tech careers.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Kx/YOW! Night with Chief Scientist Dave Thomas
events.description: Our next Kx Community Singapore Meetup, running in collaboration with YOW!, offers a great opportunity to hear from two interesting perspectives; Dave Thomas, CSO of Kx Systems and a highly regarded thought leader in the Big Fast Data Analytics space, and Tom Kearney, a hands on kdb+ consultant working directly with tier one investment banks. Agenda:  7:00 - Registration 8:00 - Dave Thomas and Tom Kearney: 'The Joys of Vector Programming' After the presentations there will be social time with food and drink provided.  Speaker Information: Dave Thomas is Chief Scientist (CSO) of Kx Systems and heads Kx Labs - dedicated to discovering new ideas and transforming them into innovative software solutions that build on existing Kx technologies. Kx Labs are currently exploring emerging areas such as Self-Service Analytics, IoT, Machine Learning and Predictive Analysis, Operational Intelligence and more. YOW! was founded by Dave in 2008 as a passion project focusing on shared learning. Tom Kearney is an Australian kdb+ consultant with First Derivatives. His educational background is Mechatronic Engineering & Finance. Recently, he has been working on big, fast data with a focus on market surveillance systems, but is also interested in applying kdb+ to problems outside of finance. To Register: Click RSVP or register your interest by email to [masked] and by clicking attend on our EventBrite page. We look forward to seeing you, Many thanks, Kx Singapore
events.location: Collision 8, 1 North Bridge Road, 8th Floor, Singapore

events.name: Azure Machine Learning: Part 1 - What is ML?
events.description: Azure Machine Learning: Part 1 - What is ML? This is Part 1 of planned 4 part series on Azure Machine Learning Speaker: Setu currently is the Technology Innovation leader for the Nielsen BUY vertical. He is responsible for driving domain differentiated analytics and devises software solutions to problems of high complexity that involve big data, business intelligence, and data analytics. Currently he and his team are involved in the application of machine learning to eCommerce datasets. Please join our new facebook group for greater interaction with this Speaker and All other MVPs and Community Leaders... https://www.facebook.com/groups/MSTechCommunitiesSG
